job_description:
Heb jij je MSc-diploma klinische psychologie (inclusief LOGO-verklaring) op zak? Ben je leergierig en werk je graag in een dynamische omgeving? Wil jij bijdragen aan de geestelijke gezondheidszorg van de 21 ste eeuw? Dan staat deze rol jou op het lijf geschreven, lees snel verder!

Wie ben jij?

Je bent optimistisch, je hebt tempo maar kunt ook vertragen wanneer nodig. Je houdt van dialoog en je hebt een goed ontwikkeld zorginhoudelijk inzicht. Je wilt onze oplossingsgerichte, online, tijdgebonden en doelgerichte aanpak uitdragen. Je gelooft in het belang van dagelijks oefenen met nieuw gedrag en de inzet van technologie daarbij. Naast het vakmanschap als psycholoog, vind je het leuk om geïnspireerd te worden door domeinen buiten de psychologie, zoals door de filosofie, sport, kunst of nieuwe technologie.

Wat ga je doen?

Als beginnend basispsycholoog bij iPractice werk je vanuit de therapeutische relatie en het vertrouwen op de veerkracht en mogelijkheden van je cliënten. Je geeft zelfstandig online behandeling aan cliënten. Dit is voornamelijk in het Nederlands, maar soms heb je ook Engelssprekende cliënten. Je werkt in een van onze behandelteams waardoor je alle facetten van onze organisatie goed leert kennen. Dit doe je via onze chatapplicatie of via videoverbinding. Daarnaast werk je nauw samen met een GZ-psycholoog, die jouw online behandeling aanvult met verdiepende gesprekken. Lees hier de ervaringen van Niki, online psycholoog bij iPractice.

Wat bieden wij?
Een 32- of 36-uur loondienstverband waarbij je tenminste 2 dagen op kantoor wordt verwacht. Je ontvangt een dienstverband/salaris met vakantiegeld, dertiende maand en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden conform de cao ggz
Bij voorkeur werk je ook 1-2 dagen per week op locatie in Den Haag.
Wij bieden bovengemiddeld ruimte voor werkbegeleiding, overleg, reflectie, persoonlijke ontwikkeling en opleiding
Je werkt in een mooie en inspirerende omgeving omdat wij geloven in een healing environment voor zowel cliënt als behandelaar
Veel ondernemende, energieke collega's die graag samenwerken en hun successen samen vieren
Volledig verzorgde lunch en gezellige borrels
Om richting te geven aan je professionele ontwikkeling, ontvang je (indien in loondienst) een opleidingsbudget, die je kan besteden aan congressen, externe supervisie en cursussen
Hoe ziet het sollicitatieproces eruit?

Is je interesse gewekt?

Wij komen graag met je in contact!

Wil je ook een bijdrage leveren aan de GGZ van de toekomst? Solliciteer direct via onze website. Of stuur een email naar Lotte van 't Leven, Talent Acquisition Specialist bij iPractice via lottevantleven@ipractice.nl

UX Researcher - Accommodations

Location: Amsterdam

Full time


About the job

As a researcher, you work closely with your team to gather insights and define the understanding of Booking customers. You partner with your team to understand guests and/or accommodation providers - and how we can improve their experiences. Your insights inspire cross-functional partners on current product improvements and can inform new products. You contribute to the culture of the research team by participating in efforts and initiatives that move toward well-informed, objective, data-oriented decision-making across Booking.com.


You are an empathetic collaborator within the research craft community. You are an experienced communicator and will work closely with your cross-functional partners in design and product.


You bring solid experience in research methods across several phases of the product development cycle. You have excellent knowledge of experimental design and primary research methods (ex. surveys, diary studies and interviews) as well as secondary & expert methods (such as literature reviews, cognitive walkthroughs and desk research). You are comfortable pursuing autonomous and independent activities, along with working with Senior Researchers to develop and grow.
As a Researcher you will:

Plan and conduct independent research to collect and analyze customer behavior through a variety of qualitative and/or quantitative methods.
Collaborate with other functions to understand and incorporate technical and business requirements into research.
Define and measure quantitative UX goals and metrics in collaboration with senior Researchers, Designers, Analysts and Product Managers.
Support a user-centered design approach by collaborating closely with UX and product stakeholders and others in the business.
Be the users' advocate, ensuring their needs are central to strategy, product, design and implementation decisions.
Take guidance from Seniors within the business to improve on research quality, and other craft improvements.
Test out new ways of gathering customer insights through new research tools or by mixing methods.


Experience (essential):

3+ years' UX research delivery in a consultancy, agency or in-house setting.
Degree or higher degree in psychology, behavioral sciences, HCI, economics or similar (more experience can substitute for this).
Knowledge of how to use a variety of UX research methods (qualitative and quantitative), with a strong awareness of their pros and cons.
Experience using a variety of commercial UX Research or VOC software tools.
Strong analytical skills, with a demonstrated ability to distill the output of complex and disparate datasets
Knowledge of user centered design principles and best practices.


Experience (desirable):

Awareness of experimentation principles
Ecommerce or travel industry exposure
B2B and B2C experience / researching needs in B2B and B2C context
Affinity with complex topics

Your qualities:

Analytical – Investigative, inquisitive, always asking 'why?'
Collaborative – Able to facilitate effective working among colleagues in various roles.
Organized – Capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously
Articulate – Able to convey customer insights persuasively and accurately.
Principled – Focused on the right outcome for users.


About the Research team

Our Research community of ~75 researchers and 7 Research Operations specialists will help you do your best work. You will have the opportunity to work with and learn from researchers across Booking.com through regular meetups, mentor programs and internal research tools.


Recruitment process

Research project review
Phone call with our recruiter
Interview with our Research manager
Research craft interview with 2 researchers (a business case)
Design & Product interview


Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.
Pre-Employment Screening:

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.

job_titles: Psycholoog of Orthopedagoog als Gedragswetenschapper Forensische Jeugdhulp

job_description: Bewaak jij de kwaliteit van onze software?Full-time · AmersfoortAls software tester ben jij een essentieel component in het softwareontwikkelproces. Eindgebruikers zien enkel dat onze S3 Passenger suite naadloos werkt, maar écht goede software opleveren? Dat is een vak. En dat betekent er iemand een kritische blik kan werpen op onze code.Ben jij iemand die kritisch en analytisch is? Die graag een bijdrage levert aan het verbeteren van de kwaliteit van software? Iemand die bij een bedrijf wil werken dat voorop loopt met betrekking tot software testen?Jouw profielEerder was een softwaretester iemand die handmatig keek of software voldeed aan de minimale vereisten. Dit ging vaak via handmatig testen, kijken naar functionele aspecten. In de huidige markt zorgen methodes als DevOps en Agile ervoor dat er een nieuwe generatie softwaretesters nodig is. Er zijn steeds meer tools voor testautomatisering.Voor deze nieuwe generatie testers is het belangrijk dat ze kennis hebben van geautomatiseerd testen, goed in teamverband kunnen samenwerken en dus communicatief vaardig zijn. De tester van de toekomst weet gebruik te maken van de techniek maar met een gezonde dosis inzicht en gevoel.Heb je?Minimaal een afgeronde HBO opleiding;Proactieve houding;Sterk analytisch denkvermogen;Een stevige dosis leergierigheid en nieuwsgierigheid;En ben je iemand die zich wil verdiepen in dit uitdagende vakgebied? Dan ben jij misschien wel onze volgende trainee._"Oorspronkelijk volgde ik de studie Psychologie, en studeerde af met een masters in Human Factors & Engineering Psychology. Hierbij heb ik veel geleerd over de menselijke kant van technologie, maar ik wilde ook graag meer weten over de technische kant. Het traineeship software tester was technisch gezien laagdrempelig genoeg dat ik ook zonder technische opleiding kon beginnen._De reden dat ik gebleven ben en nog steeds met heel veel plezier bij Sqills werk is omdat ik nog elke keer opnieuw wordt uitgedaagd. Je blijft hier nieuwe dingen leren. Ook met nieuwe technieken introduceren is het vaak zoiets van “gewoon proberen” en kijken of we er voordeel aan hebben. Zo blijft het werk constant innovatief en uitdagend"Lisanne - Voormalig trainee - tegenwoordig software testerGa jij de stap maken naar Software Tester?Wacht dan niet langer en meld je aan voor ons traineeship!Soort dienstverband: Fulltime

At Picnic, we're revolutionizing the way people buy groceries with our innovative and sustainable app-only service. We do almost everything in-house, developing cutting-edge technologies and processes to ensure we continue to grow rapidly without missing a beat. If you're a passionate People Business Partner, we're offering you the opportunity to join the diverse team at our Amsterdam HQ and make a real difference in our scaleup environment.


 In a nutshell

Our People Team strives to revolutionize human resources in the same way that Picnic has revolutionized grocery delivery. We're looking for someone to take responsibility for the development and organization of our teams in the Analyst domain, a scope with approximately 75-100 Picnic-ers.

Your responsibilities will vary from conducting reviews, working on people-related projects, and having development conversations with our teams. You'll demonstrate an understanding of the business and act as a thought leader regarding people topics. You'll partner with a cross-functional group of experts to design and execute the strategy for how your assigned team staffs, onboards, develops, rotates, motivates, retains, and organizes.


 What you'll do
Drive performance and talent by conducting check-ins and bi-annual reviews with employees
Conduct all admin-related tasks around development agreements, contracts, and compensation
Be a trusted advisor and a coach to the leadership team and play a critical role in enhancing leadership effectiveness
Drive people-related initiatives, provide insightful data to guide decision-making, and provide proactive solutions
Design and improve people programs (including staffing, onboarding, learning & development and rotation processes)
Build organizational health by ensuring that the organization is structured to achieve business objectives
Manage talent to ensure the right people are in the right roles
Enable business leaders to cultivate an effective leadership pipeline

About you
Master's degree in HR, Psychology or similar
3 to 5 years of experience as an HR Advisor, HR Business Partner, or similar
Experience in partnering with analysts and/or consultants is a plus
Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively with multiple stakeholders
Project management and operations experience
Driven to challenge convention and reinvent how work is done
Ability to see the big picture and data-driven approach
Passionate about people and able to work with colleagues of all levels
Fluency in English (Dutch not required)


 Picnic perks

Every expert was once a beginner!

You'll get plenty of opportunities to challenge yourself and grow, including the Picnic Tech Academy, Lunch & Learn sessions, and tailored soft skills training. We also offer free professional weekly language courses.

Make a difference

You'll work in an awesome scale-up environment with the freedom to drive your own projects and create a visible impact.

Our fully electric vehicles and sustainable business model mean you'll also be contributing to making the world a better place!

Teamwork makes the dream work

With more than 80 nationalities across 3 countries, you'll be part of a diverse company with plenty of cool stuff to get involved with, from board game evenings to after-work drinks to our company ski trip and more!

You are what you eat

You'll get freshly prepared, healthy lunches and snacks (with plenty of vegetarian, vegan, and halal options). Coffee snob? Don't worry, our amazing Picnic barista has you covered.

Stay healthy

Mental health is important. As well as having the option to speak with Picnic colleagues who act as confidential advisors, our collaboration with OpenUp gives you easy access to professional psychologists, along with workshops and materials.

There are plenty of sports communities and events to get involved with, from tennis to yoga to climbing!

Attractive package

We offer competitive compensation and a pension plan that looks out for your future self.

Work-life balance

Where possible, we like to enable people to work in ways that suit their working styles, which is why we have a hybrid-working model. Our teams generally like to have at least one team day per week at the office (the tasty lunch and Barista-made coffee may be a factor), but besides that, it's up to you and your team.

Benefits for expats

It can be daunting starting a new job AND moving to a new country. That's why we offer lots of support for our many expat colleagues, including:

Relocation package: If you join Picnic from abroad, we'll cover your trip to Amsterdam, sponsor your Visa, and offer you a month of accommodation while you settle in (as long as regulations allow).
In the Netherlands, we offer support with your first tax report as well as arranging the 30% ruling.
From health insurance to living arrangements to pet passports, there are always colleagues who've faced the same challenges and are more than happy to help!

Commitment to equal opportunities

Picnic is an equal opportunity employer—this means that all decisions regarding applications will be based on qualifications and merit. Applicants will be regarded independently of age, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, ethnicity, skin color, civil status, religious beliefs, physical or mental disability, or any other factors protected by law.

At Picnic, we celebrate and value our differences and are committed to building a safe and inclusive working environment where everyone can be themselves.

Ben jij een echte pionier en heb jij ervaring met de verschillende onderzoeksgebieden van het service management landschap? Kun jij niet wachten om aan de slag te gaan bij een van de leukste werkgevers van Nederland? TOPdesk zoekt een UX Researcher!

Wat ga jij doen als UX Researcher?
Mogelijke onderzoeksgebieden identificeren om in te duiken! Je stelt onderzoeksplannen op en gaat gebruikers werven. Bijvoorbeeld: uitzoeken hoe klanten graag groepen mensen in de TOPdesk-software willen organiseren. Hoe je dat aanpakt? Dat is aan jou! Waarom al dat onderzoeken? Als echte UX Researcher ben jij benieuwd naar de achterliggende motivatie van gebruikers. De behoeften en problemen van klanten zijn voor jou het perfecte startpunt voor productontwikkeling. Je werkt nauw samen met Product Owners, UX Designers en Scrum-teams om de behoeften van gebruikers te ondersteunen. Ook check jij hoe de gebruikers het product ervaren na een aantal maanden gebruik. Naast onderzoek doen, presenteer jij jouw resultaten overtuigend aan je stakeholders binnen de organisatie. Met jouw input wordt door product managers beslist hoe de roadmap eruit komt te zien!

Waar kom jij terecht?
Je komt in een developmentteam terecht en wordt ook lid van het UX guild. Het UX guild is onderdeel van de afdeling development, welke weer verdeeld is over drie landen: Nederland, Duitsland en Hongarije. In het UX guild zitten 20 gepassioneerde UX Designers en Researchers die erop gebrand zijn gebruiksvriendelijke software te maken.

Waar? Bij TOPdesk! Een van de beste werkgevers van Nederland. Er wordt veel aandacht besteed aan jouw persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling. Fouten maken? Dat mag. Regelmatig worden presentaties gegeven en kennis gedeeld, zodat je continu nieuwe dingen leert. Je horizon verder verbreden? TOPdesk moedigt het bezoeken van conferenties enthousiast aan! UXInsights is een graag bezocht favoriet. Daarnaast krijg jij tijd én budget voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling! Je kunt 10% van je tijd gebruiken voor training in jouw interesseveld, zoals het aanleren van nieuwe onderzoeksmethoden.
Ben jij onze nieuwe UX Researcher?
Jij hebt een afgeronde WO-opleiding in Human-Computer interaction, Psychologie, Antropologie of vergelijkbare vakgebieden.
Jij hebt meer dan twee jaar ervaring als UX Researcher.
Jij communiceert eenvoudig in Engels, zowel gesproken als in schrift. Nederlands spreken en schrijven is een pré.
Jij vertaalt gemakkelijk je onderzoeksresultaten naar inzichtelijke actiepunten.
Jij kan de vragen identificeren die moeten worden beantwoord om de UX-concepten van het team te definiëren
Jij bent in staat om potentiële onderzoeksgebieden te identificeren.
Waar doe je het voor?
Werken bij een van de leukste werkgevers van Nederland.
Bijdragen aan een internationaal, groeiend bedrijf.
Een salaris dat met je meegroeit.
Maandelijks € 50 vitaliteitsbudget.
Je eigen laptop: kies jij voor Windows of macOS?
10 to Grow: tijd en budget voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Vrijwilligerswerk onder werktijd.
Betaald ouderschapsverlof.
8 flexibele feestdagen in plaats van de officiële Nederlandse feestdagen.
Meer weten? Lees dan ons blog over alle perks of the job.
Solliciteren?
Klinkt dit als iets voor jou? Stuur dan je motivatiebrief en cv naar ons toe via het sollicitatieformulier.

Tips voor je brief? We vinden het belangrijk dat je innovatief bent, goed kunt samenwerken en analytisch bent. We horen daarom graag, aan de hand van een voorbeeld, wat deze competenties voor jou betekenen. We zijn natuurlijk ook benieuwd waarom je op precies deze functie reageert en waarom je graag bij TOPdesk wilt werken.

Heb je nog vragen over deze functie? Neem dan contact op met Vera Zwikker via 015 270 09 00. En maak in dit blog alvast kennis met al onze Recruiters!

Connecterra is on a mission to empower the dairy industry to increase productivity while reducing the impact on the planet. Founded in 2015, we believe making data accessible and actionable for stakeholders across the value chain is key to making a transition to more sustainable farming. Our solution is the Enterprise platform. The platform is powered by real-time farm data and currently features a set of core capabilities and high value insights. Each capability and insight can be combined or used independently to create solutions for farmers, their advisors and industry partners. Platform insights and collaborative tools are delivered through the easy-to-use Enterprise app, which is available in your language on mobile, tablet or desktop.
Connecterra is headquartered in Amsterdam, the Netherlands with local teams in Europe, the United States and New Zealand. The Enterprise platform is powering solutions in 16 countries, and we have partnerships with dairy industry leaders around the globe. Check out our recent press coverage to learn more about us “in the news.”
Our hiring ethos
We seek only the best and brightest who have a hunger to excel in their craft and will make a positive & unique addition to our culture and team. Your attitude and commitment to working as a part of this team, to come up with new ideas, solve problems and deliver results is what matters most to us.
We are bunch of highly motivated, engaging, fun and supportive people. We work as a team but hold each other accountable to our responsibilities. We offer you a platform to do the best work of your life, be involved with an interesting product and part of a unique, diverse and collaborative environment, your genuine desire to be an integral part of our mission means a lot to us.
You are our People Operations Specialist
For our headquarters in Amsterdam, we are looking for a People Operations Star! Your main responsibilities are to make sure People operations runs smoothly and processes are seamless. You are personable and able to communicate across all levels and locations (NL, US, UK, PA, MA) internally & externally. You can take on diverse challenges and quickly adapt with a problem solving and hands-on mentality. You’ll be reporting to Basak, the People Manager.
This role comes with a 24 hrs/week contract. While some of the work can be done at home, working from the office regularly is required.


You’ll be responsible for managing all People Ops including but not limited to:

Keeping all our systems up to date including our HRIS (HiBob), our pension, insurance and ARBO portals
Manage accurate payrolls together with our external partners, including pension & time-off and parental leave admin
Ensure all onboarding and offboarding processes are running smoothly
Ensure contract and document management, incl. processing standard changes and filing
Expat support: Support during relocations, 30% ruling applications, HSM visa applications, extensions, terminations
Recruitment support: Arrange interviews, create offer letters and contracts
You are passionate about a great candidate and employee experience and continuously seek to improve our people and system processes and proactively make suggestions for optimizing them together with the People Manager
Together with the People Manager, you help nurture an engaging company culture
Assist in running employee engagement surveys
Make sure our policy documents are always up to date, including but not limited to our Employee Handbook and Welcome Guides
Up to date knowledge of Dutch labour law is a must, US labour law knowledge is a plus

Who are you?
You have at minimum a Bachelors Degree from a relevant field (Psychology, HR etc.)
You have minimum 2 years work experience in a role as HR specialist preferably in a fast-paced tech start-up environment
You strive for supporting people and helping others
You are highly accurate and have a strong eye for details
You are proactive, do not shy away from taking initiatives and getting things done
You have a social character, positive energy and great interpersonal skills
You mastered self-organization, planning and time management skills; you can work independently and deal with short deadlines
You are tech-savvy and comfortable with learning new tools
You keep your head cool under pressure
You have excellent written and verbal communication in English. Dutch would be a bonus but not necessary
You live in the Netherlands and have the right to work within the EU
What's in it for you?
Every day we work hard on making the world a better place, thus the happiness and well-being of our team members is important to us. We currently offer the following:
Working with a purposeful, socially conscious and fearless team
A truly diverse, international, open-minded and creative working environment where all are welcome
Competitive compensation package
Pension contribution
Hybrid Working Environment
Flexible working hours and vacation policy - we trust you and your time is yours to own Work in an environment and on a schedule that suits you and your team best & enjoy unlimited holiday days
Monthly Wellbeing Allowance
Working From Home Allowance
Quarterly company-wide Selfie Days - take a day on us to relax, do what you need to do to stay mentally healthy
The opportunity to play a vital role in an exciting start-up - we welcome your voice & input

If you've read this far and feeling excited, then why not apply? We look forward to reading your application!

Want to create value with digital and turn your ideas into human impact? So do we.

There’s one in every group—the person who dreams big and has the motivation to bring their ideas to life, even as others might roll their eyes and prefer to play it safe. Are you that person? One who isn’t afraid to break with tradition and who is passionate about the power of digital to transform organisations and ways of working? Because we are building teams of people like that to help our clients unlock the power they need now and own what’s next.

At Avanade Advisory, we are breaking apart the traditional process of setting strategies and goals first, then finding technologies to achieve them. In the digital age, there’s no time for that linear process. We partner with clients to accelerate value from digital innovation by being ambitious, imaginative - and fast. We think big and deliver personally. We relentlessly challenge, inspire, and support our clients and each other.

Want the agility and energy of a start-up, backed by the resources of Accenture, Microsoft and the Center for Information Systems Research at MIT Sloan School of Management? Here you will find a team of people who thrive on turning ideas and innovations into breakthrough results for leading organisations around the world. Ultimately, we’re not just making business better. We’re making life better for our clients and their customers.

If that sounds like you, you sound good to us. Find your next opportunity at Avanade Advisory.

About the role

Avanade is looking for a Medior Organisational Change Management (OCM) Consultant to join their OCM team. As part of Avanade’s Advisory Group, our role is to help clients develop and deliver their digital workplace strategies and addressing the organisational and employee impact. This is a non-technical role that focuses on people and organisational change, working within an exciting and dynamic technology driven consultancy practice.

The mission is to support our clients in understanding the organisational and people impact of their digital journey. Working with our clients we help them define change strategies to transform their working structures and processes, drive adoption and deliver the expected return on their digital workplace strategy. You will focus on the organisational, people and process side of change.

We have a big passion for the work we do at Avanade, by joining the team you will feel valued and will have the chance to work flexibly and participate in many fun activities such as knowledge sessions, monthly focus groups and quarterly practice meetings.

In this role, you will:
Understand the client’s business change journey and be responsible for the implementation of the change strategy drawn up by the Change Leads, in collaboration with the client. You are the one who likes to develop and deliver training, review and guide junior colleagues in creating other support materials, and implement the communication plan. You get a kick out of presenting and standing in front of groups and can use your creativity to identify and build appropriate change strategies. You are curious and always willing to broaden your knowledge and experience. Depending on your interests, you can develop broadly towards a business consultant, change lead and even digital transformation lead.

Your skills:

Up to 4 years of relevant work experience in the field of change management.
Strong communication, presentation and facilitation skills, both verbally and in writing, in English (required) and Dutch (required.
Have a real passion for technology and how it positively influences development of the workplace and employee roles and experience.
Strong analytical skills.
Organised, proactive and enthusiastic
Master’s degree in Behavioural Sciences, Organisational Psychology, Organisational Science or related studies.
Knowledge of PROSCI is beneficial.

What’s in it for you?

Transparent career progression, with a focus on your strengths and coaching from senior colleagues.
An attractive salary and on-target compensation plan.
Work alongside Avanade specialists who are solving some of the biggest industry challenges across the globe with innovative thinking and cutting-edge tools.
Access to leading-edge technology that will give you the opportunity to deepen your existing skills even as you help create the latest business trends.
Access to our network of start-ups and partners.
Opportunities to make a difference to the communities in which we work and live.

What we offer you

Come for the distinctive experiences you have helping forward-thinking corporations, non-profits, and governments push the boundaries of digital innovation. Stay for the limitless learning opportunities that encourage you to master Microsoft and pursue big ideas. Enjoy ambitious growth for yourself as part of Avanade’s people-first culture with benefits like employee share purchasing, flexible work arrangements, a commitment to diversity and inclusion, and competitive pay.
